content.description:
Aeneas on the Shores of the Styx

Quisquis es, armatusarmatus, -a, -um, adj.: armed qui nostra ad flumina tendis, 
fare age, quid venias, iam istincistinc, adv.: from there et comprimecomprimo, -ere: to restrain comprimo, -ere: to restraingressumgressus, -us, m.: step. 
Umbrarum hic locus est, somni noctisque soporaesoporus, -a, -um, adj.: sleep-bringing: 
corpora viva nefasnefas, n.: an impious act StygiaStygius, -a, -um, adj.: Stygian, of the river Styx vectarevecto, -are: to carry carinacarina, -ae, f. = navis, -is.
content.question: Line 3 (Umbrarum...soporae) is translated

choices.label: this is a shady place of sleep during sleep-bringing night
this is the place of shades, sleep, and sleep-bringing night
in this place the shades are asleep, and there is sleep-bringing night
this man has a place among the shades of sleep and sleep-bringing night

content.answer: this is the place of shades, sleep, and sleep-bringing night

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
